00030 #ifndef _SPECIAL_H_
00031 #define _SPECIAL_H_
00032 
00033 #include "defs.h"
00034 //
00035 // - Definition of the classes for communication over the root::special() method.
00036 // - Definition of return values for the rec() method
00037 // - Definition of argument structure for the export() method
00038 //
00039 
00040 
00041 //
00042 // Communication between objects with the special() method
00043 // - add a new value to enum specmsg_typ for every new purpose
00044 //
00045 //tolua_begin
00046 typedef enum    {
00047   WriteVciTabType, // Write the vci table: for Demux
00048   GetDistTabType,  // Get the pointer to the r.n. distribution table
00049   ABRConReqType,
00050   ABRConFinType,
00051   TCPConReqType
00052 } specmsg_typ;
00053 
00054 //
00055 // basic class for special()
00056 //
00057 class   specmsg {
00058 public:
00059   inline specmsg(specmsg_typ t) { type = t; }
00060   // message type
00061   specmsg_typ type;             
00062 };
00063 
00064 //
00065 // Class for writing the VCI table of a demux
00066 //
00067 class   WriteVciTabMsg: public specmsg {
00068 public:
00069   inline WriteVciTabMsg(void): specmsg(WriteVciTabType) {}
00070   inline ~WriteVciTabMsg(){};
00071   int old_vci;  // old VCI
00072   int new_vci;  // new VCI
00073   int outp;     // direct to this output
00074 };
00075 
00076 //
00077 //      Class for importing the r.n. table of a Distribution object
00078 //
00079 class GetDistTabMsg: public specmsg {
00080 public:
00081   inline GetDistTabMsg(void): specmsg(GetDistTabType) {}
00082   inline ~GetDistTabMsg(){};
00083   inline void setTable(void *table){table = table;}
00084   inline void* getTable(void){return table;}
00085 //tolua_end
00086 //private:
00087   tim_typ *table;
00088 }; //tolua_export
00089 
00090 //
00091 //      Class to establish an ABR connection
00092 //
00093 class ABRConReqMsg: public specmsg {
00094 public:
00095   inline ABRConReqMsg(void): specmsg(ABRConReqType) {}
00096   inline ~ABRConReqMsg(){};
00097   int Requ_Flag;        // connection refused? (!= 0)
00098   char *refuser;        // name of refuser
00099   char **routp;         // pointer to the routing names
00100   int numb_RoutMemb;    // number of route members (without source)
00101   int akt_pointer;      // next routing member
00102   int next_att;         // after SimTime + next_att try to connect again
00103   
00104   int VCI;              // for conn.disting.in muxer
00105   int TBE;              // negotiation-param.
00106   double ICR;           // -"-,initial cell rate
00107   double  PCR;          // nessecary?
00108   double MCR;           // if a obj. can not support MCR->conn.refuse
00109   
00110 };
00111 
00112 //
00113 //      Class to release an ABR connection
00114 //
00115 class ABRConFinMsg: public specmsg      {
00116 public:
00117   inline ABRConFinMsg(void):specmsg(ABRConFinType) {}
00118   inline ~ABRConFinMsg(){};
00119   int Finish_Flag;      // connection release refused? (!= 0)
00120   char *refuser;        // name of refuser
00121   char **routp;         // routing members
00122   int numb_RoutMemb;    // number of route members (without source)
00123   int akt_pointer;      // next routing member
00124   int next_attempt;     // try again after this period of time
00125   
00126   int VCI;              // for conn.disting.in muxer
00127   
00128 };
00129 
00130 //tolua_begin
00131 //
00132 // Class for TCP connection request
00133 //
00134 class TCPConReqMsg: public specmsg      {
00135 public:
00136   inline TCPConReqMsg(void): specmsg(TCPConReqType) {}
00137   inline ~TCPConReqMsg(){};
00138   int wnd;
00139   int MTU;
00140   int TS;
00141   double tick;
00142   double bitrate;
00143   
00144   root  *ptrTcpSend;
00145 };
00146 //tolua_end
00147 
00148 //
00149 // Return values of the rec()-method
00150 //
00151 
00152 #ifdef  NEVER
00153 typedef enum    {
00154   // Standard return value:
00155   ContSend,     // data item accepted, no further action
00156   
00157   // Return value for the Start-Stop protocol:
00158   StopSend      // data item accepted, 
00159                 // but this was the last item before input buffer overflow
00160 } rec_typ;
00161 #endif
00162 
00163 //tolua_begin
00164 //
00165 // Extended definition of the rec() return value
00166 //
00167 typedef int rec_typ;
00168 
00169 typedef enum {  
00170 
00171   // the data item has been accepted completely, we can continue to send
00172   ContSend = -2,
00173 
00174   // data item accepted completely, but we must stop to send
00175   StopSend = -1
00176         
00177   // all other values (only >= 0):
00178   // We must stop to send, and *logically* the data item has been
00179   // rejected. This means, that the *physical* data object remains
00180   // at the receiver, but the receiver has only accepted the amount of
00181   // associated data given by the return value. This may include that the 
00182   // receiver accepted only a part of the data, or even nothing (retval == 0).
00183   // In case all data have been accepted, but we shall stop to send,
00184   // the receiver *must* return StopSend.
00185 } startstop_typ;
00186 
00187 //
00188 // Argument structure for the export() method
00189 //
00190 struct  exp_typ {
00191   //tolua_end
00192   typedef enum  {
00193     IntScalar,
00194     IntArray1,
00195     IntArray2,
00196     DoubleScalar,
00197     DoubleArray1,
00198     DoubleArray2
00199   } ExpAddrType;
00200 
00201   //tolua_begin 
00202   char  *varname;               // name of the desired variable
00203   //tolua_end
00204   int   ninds;                  // number of indizes specified
00205   
00206   enum {EXP_DIM_MAX = 3};
00207   int indices[EXP_DIM_MAX];       // the specified indizes
00208   int dimensions[EXP_DIM_MAX];    // dimensions of the array the returned pointer points to
00209   int displacements[EXP_DIM_MAX]; // for each returned dimension: diplacement
00210                                   // between a value and its position in the array
00211   
00212   // the address type
00213   ExpAddrType addrtype;           
00214   // address itself
00215   union {
00216     int *pint;
00217     int **ppint;
00218     double *pdbl;
00219     double **ppdbl;
00220   };
00221   
00222   // An auxiliary method to check and shift indices.
00223   // - defined and commented in data.c
00224   char  *calcIdx(int *, int);
00225 
00226 }; //tolua_export
00227 
00228 #endif  // _SPECIAL_H_
